page.title: 18A MARKET FOR HEDON
page.content: {Local News.}If you've been reading the local newspapers recently you will know about the plans for a new market.Some people are opposed to this but do they realise that Hedon has had markets in the past? In Hedon 400 years ago there was a{food and clothes market, and a fortnightly{cattle and {sheep sale}held at Market Hill.The markets moved to{Market Place}and continued up to 1886. At this time there was a cattle plague which killed many cattle. The arrival of the railway was another reason for the closure of the local markets. In Market Place a cruel sport called Bull Baiting was held. The bull was tied to a ring on the cobbled street and was set upon by bulldogs or mastiffs and was killed.The{Bull Ring can still be seen in the present Market Place.}
